result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis J. Marvin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis J. Marvin

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

9:37 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Travis J. Marvin in court with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. State motions to amend Count 1 to County Ordinance Disorderly Conduct Domestic enhancer. Defendant pleads No Contest to amended Count 1. Court accepts plea and orders court cost. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

9:55 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Travis J. Marvin in court with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard. Attorney Rivard states there is a resolution but requests additional time.
Hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Travis J. Marvin in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Travis J. Marvin. Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 06/27/22 at 2:15pm.
Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

LETC - Letter to defendant with signature bond ordered in court 5/9/2022. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than  5/20/2022 (Per Beth/Jail defendant was released prior to signing his bond).

(11:07 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Travis J. Marvin appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Travis J. Marvin.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on May 25, 2022 at 2:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
